contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2013}} ''John Alexander Forrest redirects here. For the New Zealand international with the same name see: [[Jack Forrest (rugby league)]]'' {{BLP sources|date=September 2009}} {{Infobox officeholder | honorific-prefix = | name = John Forrest | honorific-suffix = | image = | constituency_MP = [[Division of Mallee|Mallee]] | parliament = Australian | majority = 24.4% | predecessor = [[Peter Fisher (Australian politician)|Peter Fisher]] | successor = | term_start = 13 March 1993 | term_end = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1949|8|24}} | birth_place = [[Mildura, Victoria]] | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = Australian | spouse = | party = [[National Party of Australia]] | relations = | children = | residence = | alma_mater = [[University of Melbourne]] <br> [[University of Aberdeen]] | occupation = Design engineer | profession = | religion = | signature = | website = | footnotes = }} '''John Alexander Forrest''' (born 24 August 1949), Australian politician, has been a [[National Party of Australia|National Party]] member of the [[Australian House of Representatives]] since March 1993, representing the [[Division of Mallee]] in [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]]. He was born in [[Mildura, Victoria]], and was educated at [[University of Melbourne]] and the [[University of Aberdeen]] in [[Scotland]]. He was a design engineer with State Electricity Commission of Victoria and a lecturer at [[Ballarat College of Advanced Education]] before entering politics. He was a member of the [[Rural City of Swan Hill]] council. Forrest was one of the initial members of the [[Lyons Forum]], a conservative parliamentary [[ginger group]].<ref>Marion Maddox, ''God Under Howard: The Rise of the Religious Right in Australian Politics'',Allen & Unwin, 2005, p.38.</ref> Forrest announced his retirement on 6 March 2013, stating that he would not contest the [[Australian federal election, 2013|2013 federal election]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Veteran Nationals MP John Forrest retires|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2013-03-06/veteran-nationals-mp-retires-after-20-years27-service/4556684?section=vic|accessdate=6 March 2013|newspaper=ABC News|date=6 March 2013}}</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.jforrest.com/ Personal website] *[http://www.aph.gov.au/house/members/member.asp?id=NV5 John Forrest MP] at the House of Representatives website *{{OpenAustralia|John Forrest}} {{S-start}} {{s-par|au}} {{incumbent succession box | title={{nowrap|Member for [[Division of Mallee|Mallee]]}} | before=[[Peter Fisher (Australian politician)|Peter Fisher]] | start=1993}} {{S-end}} {{Current Victoria Representatives}} {{Persondata |NAME=Forrest, John Alexander |ALTERNATIVE NAMES= |SHORT DESCRIPTION=Australian politician |DATE OF BIRTH=24 August 1949 |PLACE OF BIRTH=[[Mildura, Victoria]], Australia |DATE OF DEATH=living |PLACE OF DEATH= }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Forrest, John Alexander}} [[Category:1949 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:National Party of Australia politicians]] [[Category:People from Mildura]] [[Category:University of Melbourne alumni]] [[Category:Members of the Australian House of Representatives]] [[Category:Members of the Australian House of Representatives for Mallee]] [[Category:Mallee (Victoria)]] [[Category:University of Ballarat faculty]] {{Australia-National-politician-stub}}
